Query: How do I mount a hibernated NTFS partition?

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Mount a device to a directory

au_1029040: How to manually mount a partition?

Top-3 Scripts:
au_304642: mount -t type device dir

sudo mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sda3 /media/windows

au_1029040: $ sudo mount -t auto -v /dev/nvme0n1p8 /mnt/Ubuntu18.04
/dev/nvme0n1p8 mounted on /mnt/Ubuntu18.04.

Explanations about Options.-t:
The argument following the -t is used to indicate the filesystem type. The
 filesystem types which are currently supported depend on the running kernel. See
 /proc/filesystems and /lib/modules/$(uname -r)/kernel/fs for a complete list of the
 filesystems. The most common are ext2, ext3, ext4, xfs, btrfs, vfat, sysfs, proc,
 nfs and cifs.

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1115905: Ubuntu mounting partition read only error
ul_164585: Cannot mount external USB drive

Explanations about Options.-l:
List the partition tables for the specified devices and then exit. If no devices
 are given, those mentioned in /proc/partitions (if that file exists) are used.

Answers.MP Summary: Create device maps from partition tables.
